timeline.bodyText:
I think the correct parameter should be '#/components/parameters/specificUser'
You can find the parameter name in UsersManagerMethod.java in the call of the getUsersBySpecificUser method.
timeline.author: balcirakpeter
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -7372,6 +7372,20 @@ paths:
         default:
           $ref: '#/components/responses/ExceptionResponse'
 
+  /urlinjsonout/usersManager/getUsersBySpecificUser:
+    post:
+      tags:
+        - UsersManager
+      operationId: getUsersBySpecificUser
+      summary: Return all users who owns the specific user.
+      parameters:
+        - $ref: '#/components/parameters/specificUserId'

replies.bodyText: This is actually correct, specificUserId is defined with the name specificUser, it is the same as with userId and user.
replies.author: bodnara

replies.bodyText: Sorry, you are right. Missed the reference.
replies.author: balcirakpeter

timeline.bodyText:
The correct response type should be '#/components/responses/ListOfUsersResponse'
Again the response type can be found in the UsersManagerMethod.java in the JavaDoc of the getUsersBySpecificUser.
timeline.author: balcirakpeter
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -7372,6 +7372,20 @@ paths:
         default:
           $ref: '#/components/responses/ExceptionResponse'
 
+  /urlinjsonout/usersManager/getUsersBySpecificUser:
+    post:
+      tags:
+        - UsersManager
+      operationId: getUsersBySpecificUser
+      summary: Return all users who owns the specific user.
+      parameters:
+        - $ref: '#/components/parameters/specificUserId'
+      responses:
+        '200':
+          $ref: '#/components/responses/VoidResponse'

timeline.bodyText: I think the operation is get and not post.
timeline.author: balcirakpeter

timeline.bodyText: The URL should be '/json/usersManager/getUsersBySpecificUser' because the method is GET type and the parameter is just a user id.
timeline.author: balcirakpeter

timeline.message:
OpenAPI getUsersBySpecificUser

* added method which returns user owners in Users Manager
